BackstoryDef.title: Alchemist’s apprentice
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the apprentice of a prominent alchemist. [PAWN_nameDef]’s master was determined to discover the formula for the legendary Panacea Elixir, a remedy to all illnesses. Under his tutelage, [PAWN_nameDef] learned about the medical sciences, including how to brew medicines from plants and herbs.

BackstoryDef.title: Educated squire
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a squire training to become a full-fledged knight. [PAWN_possessive] duties included polishing and maintaining equipment and caring for [PAWN_possessive] master’s horse. The knight [PAWN_nameDef] served was well-educated, and passed along his knowledge about history and philosophy to [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Corrupt squire
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a squire in the service of a dishonourable knight. [PAWN_pronoun] was routinely ordered to help [PAWN_possessive] master win tournaments by any means necessary. [PAWN_nameDef] would sabotage equipment, blackmail opponents, and even poison horses.

BackstoryDef.title: Lowborn squire
BackstoryDef.description: Despite not being of noble blood, [PAWN_nameDef] was taken on as a squire by a kind and chivalrous knight. The knight spent very little time at court, preferring to wander the kingdom helping others, [PAWN_nameDef] ever at his side. [PAWN_nameDef] gained an appreciation for adventure, travel, and aiding those in need, and resolved to see [PAWN_possessive] training as a knight through so that [PAWN_pronoun] could continue to do so.

BackstoryDef.title: Reluctant squire
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] didn't want to be a squire, and most certainly didn’t want anything to do with tournaments or battles or things of that sort. However, [PAWN_possessive] family gave [PAWN_objective] little choice in the matter, and [PAWN_nameDef] found [PAWN_objective]self in the service of a particularly demanding knight as soon as [PAWN_pronoun] was of age.

BackstoryDef.title: Wealthy merchant’s child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the child of a wealthy merchant who traded in exotic goods. [PAWN_pronoun] spent [PAWN_possessive] childhood surrounded by fine silks and foods made with expensive ingredients. [PAWN_possessive] family was able to afford a private tutor for [PAWN_objective] as well as several servants who attended to [PAWN_objective] every need.

BackstoryDef.title: Helpful merchant’s child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the child of a merchant. [PAWN_pronoun] often helped on market days by loading up the pack animals and making sure they were fit to travel. [PAWN_nameDef]'s family was moderately wealthy, and [PAWN_pronoun] was able to receive a basic education.

BackstoryDef.title: Young king
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was still a child when [PAWN_possessive] father, the king, died. As his oldest son, [PAWN_nameDef] was crowned as ruler despite [PAWN_possessive] young age.

BackstoryDef.title: Young queen
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was still a child when [PAWN_possessive] mother, the queen, died. As her oldest daughter, [PAWN_nameDef] was crowned as ruler despite [PAWN_possessive] young age.

BackstoryDef.title: Heir to the throne
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the next in line to become ruler of the kingdom. [PAWN_pronoun] received the best education possible from tutors who came from all over the world in order to ensure [PAWN_pronoun] was fit to rule.

BackstoryDef.title: Young royal
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the king and queen’s children. Because [PAWN_pronoun] was not the firstborn, [PAWN_pronoun] most likely would never inherit the crown. However, just in case, [PAWN_nameDef] received the type of education that a future ruler would need.

BackstoryDef.title: Proper noble child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born into a noble family. Even as a very young child, [PAWN_nameDef] had to behave with propriety in all situations, lest [PAWN_possessive] actions reflect poorly on [PAWN_possessive] family. As [PAWN_pronoun] grew, much of [PAWN_possessive] time was spent attending lessons on reading, writing and etiquette.

BackstoryDef.title: Playful noble child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born into a noble family. [PAWN_nameDef] was given many toys and games to play with, [PAWN_possessive] favourite being a little wooden horse. [PAWN_nameDef] was easily distracted when it came to lessons and caused endless frustration for [PAWN_possessive] tutors. The exception to this was riding lessons, which [PAWN_pronoun] was always enthusiastic about.

BackstoryDef.title: Spoiled noble child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was born into a noble family. [PAWN_nameDef] was extremely spoiled, and was allowed to do whatever [PAWN_pronoun] pleased and to have whatever [PAWN_pronoun] asked for. [PAWN_pronoun] would scream and cry if told “no” and was feared by [PAWN_possessive] family’s servants as a tiny tyrant.

BackstoryDef.title: Royal bastard
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the bastard child of a king, the result of an “indiscretion” with a noblewoman. To avoid scandal, [PAWN_nameDef]’s mother sent [PAWN_objective] to live with relatives in a neighbouring kingdom. [PAWN_nameDef] received the standard education given to children of noble houses, but lacked many of the privileges that those born legitimately had.

BackstoryDef.title: Stable hand
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked as a stable hand for a noble family. [PAWN_pronoun] fed and groomed the horses, mucked out their stalls, and made sure they were ready to ride when needed.

BackstoryDef.title: Kitchen helper
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] worked in the royal kitchens. [PAWN_pronoun] was tasked with scrubbing the cookware clean, as well as peeling vegetables, plucking fowl, and scaling fish. During mealtimes, [PAWN_nameDef] had to stay in the kitchens to keep an eye on any food that was still cooking, and never got to eat together with the other servants.

BackstoryDef.title: Young servant
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef]’s parents were servants in the royal castle. As soon as [PAWN_pronoun] was old enough, [PAWN_nameDef] began work as a servant as well, mostly doing the odd jobs that no one else wanted to do.

BackstoryDef.title: Apprentice
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was an apprentice to a skilled craftsman. [PAWN_pronoun] was paid almost nothing at all, but received valuable training in exchange for [PAWN_possessive] work.

BackstoryDef.title: Peasant child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a small, rural village. [PAWN_possessive] parents farmed a plot of land that was owned by a wealthy landlord. In order for the family to be able to afford rent and taxes, everyone, including [PAWN_nameDef], had to pitch in to work the farm.

BackstoryDef.title: Fisherman’s child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the child of a fisherman. [PAWN_pronoun] often helped out by repairing nets and fishing lines, catching bait worms, and performing simple maintenance on [PAWN_possessive] father’s boat.

BackstoryDef.title: Travelling minstrel child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] and [PAWN_possessive] parents were members of a travelling troupe of entertainers. [PAWN_nameDef] had naturally good hand-eye coordination and performed as a juggler. When [PAWN_pronoun] got a bit older, [PAWN_pronoun] also performed a knife throwing act.

BackstoryDef.title: Young wordsmith
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] loved to be told stories as a child. Every adult who knew [PAWN_objective] knew to expect to hear “please, tell me a story!” several times a day. As [PAWN_pronoun] got older, [PAWN_nameDef] began to make-up tales and stories of [PAWN_possessive] own. [PAWN_pronoun] was quite good at it, and [PAWN_possessive] family often spent part of their evenings sitting around a fire listening to [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Noble's bastard
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the illegitimate child of a nobleman, the result of an affair with a comely maid. In exchange for being discreet, [PAWN_nameDef]’s mother received a modest allowance, which she used to rent comfortable lodgings for herself and her child. [PAWN_nameDef] eventually began to develop an interest in the arts, and [PAWN_possessive] father increased the allowance in order to pay for an art tutor.

BackstoryDef.title: Lantern bearer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] lived in a town that had no street lamps. Instead, lantern bearing children like [PAWN_nameDef] helped to light the way for travellers at night. [PAWN_pronoun] was polite, quick, knew the streets well, and was about as highly regarded as a lantern bearer could be.

BackstoryDef.title: Innkeeper’s child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef]’s family owned a busy inn. Ever since [PAWN_pronoun] was old enough, [PAWN_nameDef] was required to help with the cooking, cleaning, and other tasks that were needed to keep the inn running.

BackstoryDef.title: Helpful child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] grew up in a small town where everyone knew everyone. [PAWN_pronoun] often wandered the town doing miscellaneous chores and tasks and was always willing to offer a helping hand to anyone who asked. This led to [PAWN_nameDef] picking up a variety of different skills.

BackstoryDef.title: Little soldier
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] loved to play soldier, pretending to be a member of the royal infantry. [PAWN_pronoun] diligently practised [PAWN_possessive] marching every day and trained swordsmanship by swinging around fallen tree branches.

BackstoryDef.title: Farrier’s child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the child of a blacksmith who specialised in shoeing horses. [PAWN_nameDef] helped to keep the horses calm while [PAWN_possessive] father worked on their hooves. When not working, [PAWN_nameDef] played with the other children of [PAWN_possessive] village, [PAWN_possessive] favourite game, of course, being horseshoes.

BackstoryDef.title: Boastful child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was the best Hoop and Stick player out of all of the children in [PAWN_possessive] village. The game was played by racing wooden hoops along the ground using sticks to keep them in motion. [PAWN_nameDef] was not a gracious winner, and [PAWN_possessive] boastfulness eventually meant that nobody wanted to play with [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: Child beggar
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] came from a very poor and very large family. [PAWN_pronoun] had far too many siblings for [PAWN_possessive] parents to even hope to feed them all. As soon as [PAWN_pronoun] was old enough, [PAWN_nameDef] was kicked out onto the streets and told to beg from others to earn [PAWN_possessive] keep.

BackstoryDef.title: Street orphan
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef]’s parents died when [PAWN_pronoun] was very young. In order to survive, [PAWN_pronoun] joined a gang of child criminals. The gang worked together to steal food and valuables, distributing the goods amongst themselves so that everyone could eat. [PAWN_nameDef] began as a lookout, but soon moved on to robbery due to [PAWN_possessive] intimidating demeanour and skill with a knife.

BackstoryDef.title: Orphan boy
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef]’s parents abandoned [PAWN_objective] as an infant, leaving [PAWN_objective] at a monastery. The monks who took care of [PAWN_nameDef] taught [PAWN_objective] how to read and write, as well as how to make the wine that the monks sold so that they could buy food for the poor.

BackstoryDef.title: Orphan girl
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef]’s parents abandoned [PAWN_objective] as an infant, leaving [PAWN_objective] at a monastery. The nuns who took care of [PAWN_nameDef] taught [PAWN_objective] how to read and write, as well as how to weave the cloth that was used to make clothing for the poor.

BackstoryDef.title: Student
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a very bright child. [PAWN_possessive] family was wealthy enough to afford school and [PAWN_pronoun] was sent off to the city to attend classes as soon as [PAWN_pronoun] was old enough. [PAWN_nameDef] was taught the trivium: grammar, logic, and rhetoric, as well as the quadrivium: arithmetic, geometry, music, and astronomy.

BackstoryDef.title: Cursed child
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was constantly sick as a child, coming close to death many times. [PAWN_possessive] family believed [PAWN_pronoun] had been hexed by a witch, and tried all manner of rituals and prayers in order to remove the curse, such as burning herbs and covering [PAWN_nameDef] in leeches to drain [PAWN_possessive] tainted blood. [PAWN_nameDef] was quite frail, and had trouble doing physically demanding tasks.

BackstoryDef.title: Flower picker
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] had trouble getting along with other children. [PAWN_pronoun] much preferred picking flowers alone to playing with the others. [PAWN_nameDef] liked to braid the flowers [PAWN_pronoun] picked into garlands and crowns.

BackstoryDef.title: Changeling
BackstoryDef.description: It was believed that [PAWN_nameDef] was a changeling, a fae who was left in place of a human baby stolen by fairies, due in part to [PAWN_possessive] unfortunate looks and low intelligence. Because [PAWN_possessive] parents didn’t believe [PAWN_pronoun] was their real child, [PAWN_nameDef] was often mistreated and forced to do extra chores.

BackstoryDef.title: Adventurous youth
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] lived in a town that was on the main road to the kingdom’s capital. Watching the comings and goings of travellers filled [PAWN_objective] with a desire to see the world. A passerby once told [PAWN_nameDef] that to travel, one must either know how to swing a sword or have the money to pay someone who can. Taking these words to heart, [PAWN_nameDef] began practising every day with a large, vaguely sword-like tree branch.
